question: Describe the annual reports of Downer company
answer:
Downer is an Australian company that provides various services including engineering, construction, maintenance, and operations. The company's annual reports provide detailed information about its financial performance and sustainability practices.

The financial reporting of Downer is contained in the Annual Financial Report, which is submitted by the Directors in compliance with the Corporations Act 2001 (Cth). The accounting policies used in the preparation of the Financial Report are consistent with those adopted in the previous year's Annual Report, with exceptions for any new or amended accounting standards.

Downer's sustainability practices are detailed in the Sustainability Report. This report, which is also available on the company's website, provides an overview of Downer's approach to managing its environmental and social risks.

The company's website, www.downergroup.com, offers comprehensive information about Downer and its services. The site contains news releases and announcements to the ASX and NZX, financial presentations, Annual Reports, Half Year Reports, and Company newsletters. Downer also prints and distributes hard copies of the Annual Report upon request for shareholders.
context:
Downer’s annual Sustainability Report provides a detailed overview of Downer’s approach to managing its environmental and social risks. The Sustainability Report is available on the Downer website at

The Directors of Downer EDI Limited submit the Annual Financial Report of the Company for the financial year ended 30 June 2022. In compliance with the provisions of the Corporations Act 2001 (Cth), the Directors’ Report is set out below.

The Company’s website www.downergroup.com offers comprehensive information about Downer and its services. The site also contains news releases and announcements to the ASX and NZX, financial presentations, Annual Reports, Half Year Reports and Company newsletters. Downer printed communications for shareholders include the Annual Report which is available on request.

The accounting policies used in the preparation of the Financial Report are consistent with those adopted and disclosed in Downer’s Annual Report for the financial year ended 30 June 2021, except in relation to the relevant new and amended accounting standards adopted by the Group and their effects on the current period or prior periods as described in Note G1.

question: provide a description about the Downer Company
answer: Downer is an Australian company that offers engineering, construction, maintenance, and operations services. The company's financial and sustainability reports are outlined in its Annual Financial Report and Sustainability Report, respectively. Downer adheres to audit independence and ensures no potential conflict of interest exists in work conducted by its external auditors, KPMG. Downer's Non-executive Director remuneration policy aims to offer fair compensation to attract and retain skilled and experienced Directors. The company's website provides extensive information about Downer, including news releases and financial reports to the ASX and NZX, annual and half-year reports, and company newsletters. Upon request, shareholders receive hard copies of the Annual Report.
context:
Downer’s customers

The following table provides an overview of the key prospects relevant to each of Downer’s service lines and summarises Downer’s intended strategic response across each sector to maximise the Company’s performance and realise future opportunities.

Downer is committed to audit independence. The Audit and Risk Committee reviews the independence of the external auditors on an annual basis. This process includes confirmation from the auditors that, in their professional judgement, they are independent of the Group. To ensure that there is no potential conflict of interest in work undertaken by Downer’s external auditors, KPMG, they may only provide services that are consistent with the role of the Company’s auditor.

Downer’s Non-executive Director remuneration policy is to provide fair remuneration that is sufficient to attract and retain Directors with the experience, knowledge, skills and judgement to steward the Company.

question: name a few employees working in downer
answer: The context does not mention any named employees working at Downer. It discusses Downer's commitment to employee safety and its efforts to manage risks.
context:
Sadly, a long-term Downer employee in New Zealand died in May 2022 following a fall at work. Although the cause of death is not yet known, Downer has treated this as a workplace fatality. This incident is a reminder of the challenges of ensuring we remain vigilant and relentlessly manage the Critical Risks associated with the work we do every day.

cause serious injury to people or harm to the environment, and the controls needed to eliminate or manage those risks, are understood. This knowledge forms the core of Downer’s risk management processes, and the monitoring of its critical controls. There is a strong commitment to Downer’s Zero Harm objectives across all levels of the business. A core objective of The Downer Standard program is to unify the way Downer manages Zero Harm and performs its work. In an important step, Downer achieved centralised third-party accreditation to the International Standards ISO 45001 (Safety), ISO 9001 (Quality) and ISO 14001 (Environment). This gives Downer a single system of work for safety, quality and environment, and a framework to develop, implement and monitor The Downer Standard. Establishing this consistent single platform means Downer can deliver consistent best practice information and work processes to its frontline employees, helping them to better manage risk and change in their dynamic workplaces. Downer continues to be vigilant around the management of COVID-19 and maintaining the highest levels of controls in line with expert advice and Government guidance. Downer supported the Government’s vaccination initiative and strongly encouraged its employees to have the vaccination when it was available to them, once they had consulted a health professional on the associated risks and benefits.
